Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim,glazed very streaky black (mostly worn) below; at bottom of sherd, traces of band in added white; exterior reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd joins Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA87. The fabric from the sherd with the sample number 'NAU 34' written in ink was analysed by P. Dupont at the Centre de recherches archéologiques, laboratoire de céramologie and the results determined that the clay from that sherd originated in Chios (Dupont and Thomas 2006, 78-9). However, Dupont identifies NA88 as the sherd analysed, but the photograph is not of the same sherd and 'NAU 34' is not labelled on NA88. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-79, 82-83, fig. 2) (NAU 34)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1209) (phase 2)
